long: Meaning: to "inherit" (as a (figurative) mode of descent), or (generally) to "occupy"; causatively, to "bequeath", or (generally) "distribute", "instate".  Usage: divide, have (inheritance), take as a heritage, (cause to, give to, make to) inherit, (distribute for, divide (for, for an, by), give for, have, leave for, take (for)) inheritance, (have in, cause to, be made to) possess(-ion).  Source: a primitive root;
